info.name: Docusign Admin API
info.description:
Docusign Admin API enables you to automate user management with your existing systems while ensuring governance and compliance.

**Additional Resources:**

- [Full API Reference](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/admin-api/reference/)
    
- [Code Examples](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/admin-api/how-to/)
    
- [MyIT Sample App](https://myit.sampleapps.docusign.com/)
    
- [SDKs](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/admin-api/sdks/)
    

<video src="https://youtube.com/embed/YLJCHGWHoqE" width="340"></video>

item.name: Authentication
01 Authorize Code Grant Access Token
02 JWT Access Token
03 Refresh Access Token
04 Get User Info

item.description:
All Docusign REST APIs use OAuth 2.0 for authenticaiton. [You can find general autnetication information on the Developer Center.](https://developers.docusign.com/platform/auth/)

Information regarding [Docusign Admin API specific scopes can be found here.](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/)

item.name: Users
Updates a user's email address.
Returns information about the users in the organization

query.description: Index of first item to include in the response. The default value is 0.
Page size of the response. The default value is 20.
Index of the last item to include in the response. Ignored if `take` parameter is specified.
Email address of the desired user. At least one of `email`, `account_id` or `organization_reserved_domain_id` must be specified.
Selects users by pattern matching on the user's email address
Status.

The user's membership status. One of:

- `activation_required`
- `activation_sent`
- `active`
- `closed`
- `disabled`
Select users that are members of the specified account. At least one of `email`, `account_id` or `organization_reserved_domain_id` must be specified.
Select users that are in the specified domain. At least one of `email`, `account_id` or `organization_reserved_domain_id` must be specified.
Select users whose data have been modified since the date specified. `account_id` or `organization_reserved_domain_id` must be specified.
Select users with groups the users belong to; The organization must have entitlement `AllowMultiApplication` enabled.

Select users with groups the users belong to; The organization must have entitlement `AllowMultiApplication` enabled.

item.name: UserImport
Import request for adding users to accounts within the organization.
Import request for updating users to accounts within the organization.
Closes the Bulk User Import request
Closes memberships which are not in an account which is part of the organization, but which do have email addresses which are @ a verified reserved web domain which belongs to the organization

variable.description: (Required) The import ID GUID for the request.

variable.description: (Required) The import ID GUID for the request.

item.name: Returns a text/csv file with user details for a User Import request

variable.description: (Required) The import ID GUID for the request.

item.description:
Methods to import users.

To ensure your CSV is properly formatted, use the
[Sample Bulk Add CSV file](https://admin.docusign.com/static-resources/organization-user-import.csv)
 as a template.

You can add up to 2,000 users to an account and include up to 50 accounts per import. The maximum number of users per import is 8,000.

item.name: Organization
Returns a list of organizations that the authenticated user belongs to.

query.description:
Specifies how to select the organizations. Valid values:

- `org_admin`: Returns organizations for which the authenticated user is an admin.
- `account_membership`: Returns organizations that contain an account of which the authenticated user is a member

Default value: `org_admin`

request.description:
Returns a list of organizations that the authenticated user belongs to.

Note that the Docusign Admin API only returns JSON, not XML.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `organization_read`.

This method requires user authentication. It will fail with an [application access token](/docs/admin-api/admin101/application-auth/).

query.description:
Specifies how to select the organizations. Valid values:

- `org_admin`: Returns organizations for which the authenticated user is an admin.
- `account_membership`: Returns organizations that contain an account of which the authenticated user is a member

Default value: `org_admin`

DataDeletion
Redacts membership data for users with memberships in an account.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account from which to delete the user's data.

item.name: Redacts membership and user data for users in an organization.

item.description:
Methods to delete user data. After a user is closed, an account or organization administrator can use these methods to delete the user's account data.

### Next steps
* Learn [how to delete user data from an account as an account administrator](/docs/admin-api/how-to/account-admin-delete-user-data/).
* Learn [how to delete user data from multiple accounts as an organization administrator](/docs/admin-api/how-to/org-admin-delete-user-data/).

item.name: AccountCloning
Get asset group accounts for an organization.

query.description: When **true,** only compliant accounts are returned and account responses do not include the `compliant` field. The default value is **false.**

request.description:
Returns a list of asset group accounts for an organization.

An asset group is a set of modules, products, plans, and charges purchased for your organization. An asset group account is an account that has been linked to an asset group.

To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `asset_group_account_read`.

### Next steps
* See [how to use this endpoint in your chosen programming language](/docs/admin-api/how-to/clone-account/).

query.description: When **true,** only compliant accounts are returned and account responses do not include the `compliant` field. The default value is **false.**

item.name: Clone an existing Docusign account.

request.description:
Clones an existing Docusign account. Cloning an account copies the plan items and eSignature settings. Users, templates, and permission profiles are _not_ copied into the target account. The new account will linked to the same organization.

In the request body, specify the source account you are cloning by its ID. You can get the IDs for your organization's asset group accounts using the [getAssetGroupAccounts](/docs/admin-api/reference/accountprovisioning/accountcloning/getassetgroupaccounts/) endpoint. 

You also need to specify information about the new target account, including the name, location, and administrator. To set the location, provide either the `countryCode` or `region` properties. (If both are specified, the `region` value will be used.) When testing in the developer environment, the region will always be `NA`.

The request body looks like this:
```
{
    "sourceAccount": {
        "id": "624e3e00-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-43918c520dab"
    },
    "targetAccount": {
        "name": "My Cloned Account",
        "admin": {
            "firstName": "Francis",
            "lastName": "Beagle",
            "email": "francis@example.com"
        },
        "region": "NA"
    }
}
```

To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization. The administrator for the target account must also be an organization admin.
* The source account must be on the same plan as your contract.
* The source account must be an asset group account. An asset group is a set of modules, products, plans, and charges purchased for your organization. An asset group account is an account that has been linked to an asset group.
* Your organization must be set up for account cloning. For more information, email self-serve-provisioning-enablement@docusign.com.

[Required scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `asset_group_account_clone_write`.

### Next steps
* See [how to use this endpoint to clone an account](/docs/admin-api/how-to/clone-account/).

item.name: Gets all asset group account clones for an organization.

query.description: Use this parameter to retrieve only account clones that were created on or after a specified date.
When **true,** include additional details for the asset group account clones. The default value is **false.**

request.description:
Retrieves all the cloned accounts for an organization.

To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization.

[Required scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `asset_group_account_clone_read`.

query.description: Use this parameter to retrieve only account clones that were created on or after a specified date.
When **true,** include additional details for the asset group account clones. The default value is **false.**

item.name: Gets information about a single cloned account.

query.description: When **true,** include additional details about the cloned account. The default value is **false.**

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the asset group.
(Required) The GUID representing the asset group account clone ID.

request.description:
Gets information about a cloned account by the `assetGroupWorkId`.

To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization.

[Required scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `asset_group_account_clone_read`.

query.description: When **true,** include additional details about the cloned account. The default value is **false.**

item.name: AccountCreation
Get information about plan items within an organization.

request.description:
Gets the plan items and subscription information for an organization.


To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization

[Required scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `organization_sub_account_read`

item.name: Creates a new Docusign account using the plan and modules specified in request body.
Get all ongoing account creation processes for an Organization.

query.description: Specifies that the request will only return information for accounts that were created after the date passed in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
When `true`, include additional details about the account creation process. The default value is `false`.

request.description:
Get ongoing account creation processes by `organizationId`.


To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization

[Required scopes](/docs/admin-api/admin101/auth/): `organization_sub_account_read`

query.description: Specifies that the request will only return information for accounts that were created after the date passed in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
When `true`, include additional details about the account creation process. The default value is `false`.

item.name: Get a single account creation process.

query.description: When true, include details for the asset group account clone.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the asset group.
(Required) The ID of the asset group account clone request.

request.description:
Gets information about an account creation process by the `assetGroupId`.


To call this endpoint:
* You must be an administrator for the specified organization

query.description: When true, include details for the asset group account clone.
